name: Simple Present Tense
explanation: The Simple Present is used for habits, universal truths, and repeated actions. In exams, watch third-person singular errors (he/she/it + s/es).
structure: Subject + base verb (add s/es for third person singular)

name: Present Continuous Tense
explanation: Used for actions happening right now or temporary actions.

name: Simple Past Tense
explanation: Used for completed actions in the past.

name: Simple Future (Will)
explanation: Used for decisions made at the moment, promises, predictions.

name: Basic Subject-Verb Agreement
explanation: A singular subject takes a singular verb. A plural subject takes a plural verb.

name: Personal Pronouns
explanation: Pronouns replace nouns. Exams test subject vs object forms (I/me, he/him).

name: Use of A and An
explanation: Use 'a' before consonant sounds and 'an' before vowel sounds.
structure: a + consonant sound | an + vowel sound

name: Use of The
explanation: 'The' is used for specific nouns, unique things, superlatives, and known references.

name: Prepositions of Time (At, On, In)
explanation: Use 'at' for exact time, 'on' for days/dates, and 'in' for months, years, long periods.

name: Coordinating Conjunctions (FANBOYS)
explanation: Coordinating conjunctions join equal clauses: For, And, Nor, But, Or, Yet, So.

questions.question: Choose correct:
options: I was tired, but I worked.
I was tired but I worked.
I was tired and but worked.

name: Modal Verb: Can
explanation: 'Can' expresses ability, permission, or possibility.

name: Modal Verb: Must
explanation: 'Must' expresses obligation or strong necessity.

name: Comparative Adjectives
explanation: Comparatives compare two things. Add -er or use 'more' for longer adjectives.

questions.question: Choose correct:
options: He is more taller than me.

name: Superlative Adjectives
explanation: Superlatives compare three or more things. Add -est or use 'most'.

name: Adverbs of Frequency
explanation: Adverbs of frequency show how often something happens.

name: Prepositions of Place (In, On, At)
explanation: Use 'in' for enclosed spaces, 'on' for surfaces, and 'at' for specific points.

name: Subordinating Conjunctions (Because, Although, If)
explanation: Subordinating conjunctions join dependent clauses to main clauses.

questions.question: Choose correct:
options: Although he was tired, he finished.

name: Possessive Pronouns
explanation: Possessive pronouns show ownership (mine, yours, his, hers, ours, theirs).
structure: Mine, yours, his, hers, ours, theirs

name: There is / There are
explanation: Use 'there is' for singular nouns and 'there are' for plural nouns.

name: Use of Capital Letters
explanation: Capital letters are used for the start of sentences and proper nouns.
structure: Capital letter at start and proper nouns

name: Present Perfect Tense
explanation: Used for actions completed at an unspecified time or with present relevance.

name: Past Continuous Tense
explanation: Used for actions ongoing at a specific time in the past.

name: Either...Or / Neither...Nor
explanation: The verb agrees with the nearest subject.
structure: Either A or B + verb (agree with nearest subject)

questions.question: Either he or his friends ____ coming.

name: Adverbs of Manner
explanation: Adverbs of manner describe how an action happens.

name: Use of Comma in Lists
explanation: Use commas to separate items in a list.

questions.question: Choose correct:
options: I bought apples, oranges, and bananas.
I bought apples oranges and bananas.
I bought apples oranges, and bananas.
I bought apples, oranges and bananas,

name: Modal Verb: May
explanation: 'May' expresses permission (formal) or possibility.

name: Reflexive Pronouns
explanation: Used when the subject and object are the same.
structure: myself, yourself, himself, herself, itself, ourselves, themselves

name: Order of Adjectives
explanation: Adjectives follow a specific order: Opinion, Size, Age, Shape, Color, Origin, Material, Purpose (OSASCOMP).
structure: Opinion → Size → Age → Shape → Color → Origin → Material → Purpose

name: Prepositions of Direction (To, Into, Onto)
explanation: 'To' shows movement toward, 'Into' shows movement inside, 'Onto' shows movement to a surface.

name: Countable and Uncountable Nouns
explanation: Countable nouns can be counted; uncountable nouns (like water or information) cannot.

name: Future with Going To
explanation: Used for planned future actions or strong predictions based on evidence.
structure: Subject + am/is/are + going to + base verb

name: Modal Verb: Should
explanation: 'Should' expresses advice or mild obligation.

name: Demonstrative Pronouns
explanation: This/That (singular) and These/Those (plural).

name: Adverbs of Time
explanation: Adverbs of time tell when something happens (yesterday, today, tomorrow).

name: Use of Question Mark
explanation: A question mark is used at the end of direct questions.
